intro: Anisanthus cunonia, commonly known as the Cape jasmine, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Anisanthus cunonia thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats.
